name: FIU Gold and Blue
value: $1000 to $12000 for Florida residents, 4,000 to $24,000 for non-Florida residents

name: FIU College Board Recognition Program Scholarship
value: 100% Undergraduate tuition and fees, plus a book stipend
about: includes $1,000 meal plan stipend per semester

name: FIU Gold and Blue (Transferring Students)
value: $1,000 to $12,000 for Florida residents, $4,000 to $24,000 for non-Florida residents
about: includes $1,000 meal plan stipend per semester

name: FIU Presidential Merit Scholarship
value: Florida Resident-100% Undergraduate tuition and fees, plus a book stipend. Otherwise see link

name: FIU College Board Recognition Program Scholarship
value: Florida Resident-100% Undergraduate tuition and fees, plus a book stipend and $1,000 meal stipend

name: RaiseMe
about: Only applies if the university financial aid is less than RaiseMe, otherwise RaiseMe covers the difference between the university aid and RaiseMe. Think of RaiseMe giving a minimum amount of aid to students.

name: Rosita Gedeon Scholarship
about: Haitian American descent, an individual of Haitian ancestry who, at the time of application, is an individual who lives in the United States and is either a United States citizen of has permanent resident status in the United States.

name: Milam Family First Generation Scholarship
about: First generation in family to get a college degree
